Description: Autoregressive coefficient for exports, representing the persistence of foreign demand.
Scalar constant for exports, acting as the baseline trend for export volume.
Variance coefficient for exports, controlling the magnitude of random shocks to foreign demand.
Autoregressive coefficient for imports, representing the persistence of foreign supply.
Scalar constant for imports, acting as the baseline trend for import volume.
Variance coefficient for imports, controlling the volatility of foreign supply.
GDP Euro Area, representing the current aggregate output of the external economic zone.
Realized growth rate of the Euro Area economy for the current period.
Aggregate price inflation in the Euro Area for the current period.
Autoregressive coefficient for Euro Area inflation (persistence of external price trends).
Constant for Euro Area inflation (baseline external inflation trend).
Variance coefficient for Euro Area inflation (volatility of external price shocks).
Autoregressive coefficient for Euro Area GDP (persistence of external output level).
Constant for Euro Area GDP (long-term baseline output for the external region).
Variance coefficient for Euro Area GDP (magnitude of external business cycle shocks).
Net creditor/debtor position of the national economy (accumulated trade balance).
Total supply of imports available to domestic buyers (real volume).
Total demand for exports from all foreign buyers.
Demand for exports of specific product varieties. Vector length scales with the number of firms.
Realised consumption by foreign consumers after market matching (total actual exports).
Supply of imports per domestic sector. Vector length matches the number of sectors (G).
Realised sales of imports per domestic sector after market matching.
Demand for imported goods per domestic sector.
Price of imports per domestic sector.
Price inflation of exports (aggregate tracking variable).
Historical time series of Euro Area GDP. Used for adaptive learning by the Central Bank. Its length grows by +1 at every simulation step.
Historical time series of Euro Area Inflation. Used for adaptive learning by the Central Bank. Its length grows by +1 at every simulation step.
